edu.macalester.turtle
Interface TurtleObserver

All Known Implementing Classes:
FancyDemo, TurtleExercise, TurtleProgram
public interface TurtleObserver

For receiving notifications of changes in a Turtle's state. This is typically for the purpose of rendering the turtle graphics, but could also be used for showing the turtle on the screen or recording its actions for later playback.

This interface gives special privilege to the two events that correspond to physical motion of the virtual turtle robot: moving and turning.

Author:
Paul Cantrell

Method Summary
 void turtleChanged(Turtle turtle)
          Called after any turtle state change not handled by this interface's other methods.
 void turtleMoved(Turtle turtle, double x0, double y0, double x1, double y1)
          Called after a turtle has handled a forward() or backward() message.
 void turtleTurned(Turtle turtle, double oldDir, double newDir)
          Called after a turtle has handled a forward() or backward() message.
 

Method Detail

turtleMoved

void turtleMoved(Turtle turtle,
                 double x0,
                 double y0,
                 double x1,
                 double y1)
Called after a turtle has handled a forward() or backward() message. The turtle traveled from (x0,y0) to (x1,y1).

This method is not called when the turtle is moved by a setter method such as Turtle.setX(double); setters represent discontinuous motion, and thus result in a call to turtleChanged(Turtle);

turtleTurned

void turtleTurned(Turtle turtle,
                  double oldDir,
                  double newDir)
Called after a turtle has handled a forward() or backward() message. The turtle traveled from (x0,y0) to (x1,y1).

turtleChanged

void turtleChanged(Turtle turtle)
Called after any turtle state change not handled by this interface's other methods. This includes, for exmaple, a change in color, pen up/down, or a change due to an absolute setter method.
